verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
krīḍāsakteṣu gopeṣu
tad-gāvo dūra-cāriṇīḥ
svairaṁ carantyo viviśus
tṛṇa-lobhena gahvaram

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śrī Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; krīḍā—in their playing; āsakteṣu—while they were completely absorbed; gopeṣu—the cowherd boys; tat-gāvaḥ—their cows; dūra-cāriṇīḥ—wandering far away; svairam—independently; carantyaḥ—grazing; viviśuḥ—they entered; tṛṇa—for grass; lobhena—out of greed; gahvaram—a dense forest.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: While the cowherd boys were completely absorbed in playing, their cows wandered far away. They hungered for more grass, and with no one to watch them they entered a dense forest.
